TopicTitle: My KSP keeps crashing immediately after running the game!

Articles.Content:
I have a very heavily modded game (1.11.1) with these mods installed:

KSPIE, Near Future Launch, Propulsion, Electrical, Far Future, Space Dust,  CryoEngines and Tanks, Kopernicus release 42, OPM, KerbalPlanetaryBaseSystems, and some support mods. I am sure I'm launching 64 bit, and I have DLC's  deactivated. The problem is, as soon as I launch ksp, the popup window goes white (it usually does for a moment) then disappears. I have searched everywhere on forums and reddit, but no one is having the same issue. I need help! And this problem has only occured a few days prior. KSP 1,8,1 with even more mods has been fine, so please help!

Thx

What popup window?

Anyway, impossible to even guess without logs.

Just now, Curveball Anders said:

What popup window?

Anyway, impossible to even guess without logs.

 

What i meant was the window that pops up after you launch thye game(the game window) additionaly, the log is called modulemanager  and is completely blank

First , install ZeroMiniAVC

Then, post a log file if that doesnt help

ok, so i semi solved it. I deleted all the mods, installed kopernicus-43, installed galaxiesunbound: a stellar odyssey deleted all unsupported mods, and it works now, and i also installed makinglesshistory. but theres a new problem if i deactivate dlcs, loading is stuck on loading expansions. if i enable dlcs, it gets stuck on verify: squadexpansion/serenity. so help pls. thx i haven't been able to play ksp properly for like a week or 2 now

11 hours ago, thatonekspgamer said:

ok, so i semi solved it. I deleted all the mods, installed kopernicus-43, installed galaxiesunbound: a stellar odyssey deleted all unsupported mods, and it works now, and i also installed makinglesshistory. but theres a new problem if i deactivate dlcs, loading is stuck on loading expansions. if i enable dlcs, it gets stuck on verify: squadexpansion/serenity. so help pls. thx i haven't been able to play ksp properly for like a week or 2 now

MakingLessHistory is only needed for Kopernicus if you plan on going to bodies farther away than stock Eeloo.  It stops craft from falling through the ground on distant bodies.

As an alternative, you can use parallax as it fixes the same bug.  It is pretty GPU intensive though.

As for your immediate problem, I'd try a steam verify or reinstall.
